layout.description: Title left-aligned, 6 bullet points with subtle icons, bottom callout bar

zones.name: title
zones.content: Sound familiar?

zones.name: bullets
items: Team A does thorough code reviews. Team B rubber-stamps.
Your deployment process lives in one senior engineer's head.
That engineer leaves. The process leaves with them.
Your 'best practices' wiki has 200 pages. Nobody reads it.
Quality gates exist in CI. They get skipped when it's Friday at 4pm.
The same bugs keep happening across different teams.

zones.name: callout
zones.content: Your engineering practices are scattered, undocumented, and non-compounding.

slides.visualTreatment: Amber dash bullets for warning/attention tone. Bottom callout in warm amber summarizes the problem. No imagery — the words are the visual.

layout.description: Title, one-line concept statement, then a 2-column before/after comparison table

zones.name: title
zones.content: What if your engineering practices were code?

zones.name: concept
zones.content: A skill is a versioned, executable unit of engineering practice.

zones.name: comparison
rows: Versioned skill that improves through use
Enforced step in a quality-gated workflow

slides.visualTreatment: Red-left / green-right comparison creates instant visual contrast. The concept statement in blue anchors the slide. Table is the focal point.

zones.name: title
zones.content: Anatomy of a Skill

zones.name: directory
zones.content:
skills/implement/
  SKILL.md        # The instruction set
  CHANGELOG.md    # Version history
  references/     # Patterns & examples
  ui.json         # Dashboard metadata

zones.name: frontmatter
zones.content:
name: implement
phase: IMPLEMENT
category: core
version: 1.0.0
depends_on: [spec, scaffold]
tags: [coding, core-workflow]

zones.name: caption
zones.content: 7-step process: understand spec → plan order → data layer → service layer → API → UI → verify

slides.visualTreatment: Two dark code blocks side by side on white. The code is the visual. Caption below grounds it in the real skill's process.

cards.label: Core
cards.highlights: implement, architect, code-review, deploy, test-gen, security-audit

zones.name: callout
zones.content: You can create your own. Every skill follows the same structure.

slides.visualTreatment: Color-coded cards give each category a distinct identity. Counts are large numbers inside the cards. The blue callout at the bottom is the key takeaway.

layout.description: Full-width horizontal flow diagram of the engineering loop with gate indicators between phases

zones.name: title
zones.content: Loops: Skills in Sequence

zones.name: definition
zones.content: A loop composes skills into a phased workflow with quality gates.

zones.name: stats
zones.content: Engineering Loop v3.0.0 — 10 phases · 13 skills · 6 gates

slides.visualTreatment: This is the hero diagram. Blue phase nodes connected by arrows, with amber diamond gate indicators between key phases. Two rows if needed to fit. The flow should read left-to-right, top-to-bottom.

layout.description: Three gate type cards in a row, each with icon, type name, behavior description. Bottom emphasis statement.

zones.name: title
zones.content: Gates That Actually Gate

cards.label: Human Gate
cards.description:
Requires explicit approval.
Spec, architecture, validation, review.

cards.label: Auto Gate
cards.description:
Passes if checks pass.
Build, tests, lint — all green.

cards.label: Conditional Gate
cards.description:
Auto-passes if no target.
Deploy gate with no deploy target.

zones.name: enforcement
zones.content: The execution engine will not advance past a gate. No exceptions.

zones.name: human-note
zones.content: Engineers retain final authority. AI assists — humans approve.

slides.visualTreatment: Three distinct cards, each color-coded to its gate type. The enforcement callout in blue at the bottom is the punchline. The human-note at the very bottom addresses the AI-skeptic in the room.
